story:
Boost productivity. Save TONS of time at your work.  

If you have laptops or computers with Thunderbolt 3*(MacBook Pro 2016/2017, iMac 2017, Dell XPS, HP Elite Series/Spectre, etc.) and you need an external hard drive, what External Solid State Drive would you choose?

What about Samsung T5, SanDisk Extreme, and Glyph Atom...?
Nah..They just cannot free up the extremity of Thunderbolt 3 interface.

What if you can transfer data 4x-5x FASTER than the mainstream portable SSDs out there in the market?
If you can transfer data at Reading 2,300MB+/s and Writing 1,300MB+/s, why choose an inferior option?
If you can transfer one blue-ray movie in under 30 secs, why bother whining about SSDs that just could not deliver the speed you want?

*Note: TEKQ Rapide SSD only supports devices with Thunderbolt 3 and are not backward compatible with devices with Thunderbolt 1 and 2. Click here to check devices with Thunderbolt 3 built: https://www.tekq.com/Thunderbolt-3/Thunderbolt-...

 

 
 
 

 

15GB Video files only takes Rapide 11 seconds to transfer!

This chart is Real World File Transfer Comparison by thessdreview.com. This is a comparison between Rapide and mainstream portable SSDs. As seen on the chart, each bar with different colors represents the seconds taken to transfer different media files at 15GB data size. 

15GB Video files only takes Rapide 11 seconds to transfer!

15GB Music files only takes Rapide 35 seconds to transfer!

15GB Photo files only takes Rapide 31 seconds to transfer!

How would that boost your productivity and save your time at work?

Considering Optane is not even a portable SSD and the mobility OWC RAID0 lacks, Rapide greatly outperforms its counterparts in terms of plug-and-play external data storage combining speed and mobility.

 

 

Rapide delivers 2x-3x much better result on transferring huge amount of media files.

The three charts above shows how the TEKQ Rapide behaves at real-world writing of different media file format(Higher is better).

For creative workers and business professionals, transferring of large amounts of photos and videos to and from the unit is the most common usage scenario, so Anandtech.com created three test folders with the following characteristics:

  • Photos: 15.6 GB collection of 4320 photos (RAW as well as JPEGs) in 61 sub-folders
  • Videos: 16.1 GB collection of 244 videos (MP4 as well as MOVs) in 6 sub-folders
  • BR: 10.7 GB Blu-ray folder structure of the IDT Benchmark Blu-ray

The tests were done on PCMark 8 Storage Bench, which recorded disk activity during real-world usage. As seen on the three charts, Rapide has beaten d2 Thunderbolt 2 SSD and Lacie Thunderbolt SSD with ease at 2x-3x faster speed rate.

Also, Rapide will save your time on importing files into or on exporting a multimedia out of editing program such as Adobe Photoshop, After Effect, and Illustrator.

 

Light, Portable, Easy to Carry

Since Rapide is Bus-Powered, you are able to plug in Rapide on your Thunderbolt 3 devices  without the need for a power adapter and backup your precious data with ease. Sized only slightly larger than a credit card(3.81in*2.16in/9.7cm*5.5cm) and weighs only 4.7oz(135g/0.29lb), Rapide is fairly pocket-friendly and won't occupy room whether it is used in an office or carried in a travel.

When we decide to buy an external SSD, we want to boost our productivity - which means it should satisfy both the speed and mobility - Rapide is the answer.

*Note: Photo with THESSDREVIEW Trademark are authorized by, and  its copyright belongs to thessdreview.com

 

Elegant and sleek look. Match with your MacBook Pro.

Last but not least, the lightweight sturdy metallic design not only matches your Mac with a sleek and elegant look, but also offers excellent heat dissipation with out fan. The extremely slim and lightweight design starts with an extruded block of aluminum that is carved out using CNC or "computer numerical control" machines.

TEKQ Rapide Thunderbolt 3 SSD  ensures you won’t have to make any compromises when it comes to speed, mobility, and durability.

*Note: Photo with TT Trademark are authorized by, and  its copyright belongs to TweakTown

 

What techies say about Rapide Thunderbolt 3?

"This is a beautiful beast with state-of-the-art guts inside. " Prof. Gabriel Dorado in Universidad de Cordoba

"TEKQ took a giant leap with the Rapide, offering top tier performance for a single drive Thunderbolt 3 solution while staying competitive with its curent market pricing." TweakTown

" It is drop dead gorgeous.  It’s storage speeds are not matched by anything worldwide." thessdreview.com

"The performance of the TEKQ Rapide is top-notch and meets the claimed numbers." Anandtech.com

"For a new product from a relatively no-name company, I am impressed with the design and performance of the TEKQ Rapide."pcper.com

"The TEKQ Rapide is completely silent (and I can hear high frequencies so I say this with confidence)." macperformanceguide.com

"The Sonnet Fusion Thunderbolt 3 PCIe Flash (Bus-Powered) Drive now has competition from the TEKQ TB3 Rapide in terms of speed, size, weight, and price." barefeats.com

     

 

 

Why we build the product?

External data storage devices have evolved rapidly over the past few years. The evolution starts with the Hard Disk Drive (HDD) with USB 3.0 interface that's pricey and delivers only 150MB/s; then there comes high-performance external Solid-State Drives (SSD) that take advantage of the USB 3.0 and USB3.1 interface that allow us to transfer data at 500MB/s. The introduction of Peripheral Component Interconnect Express (PCIe) SSDs have enabled mass-market storage devices to break the SATA barrier. However, USB3.1 connection interface just could not free up the extremity of PCIe SSDs. Thunderbolt 3, the latest version of the Thunderbolt connection interface—is born to work with PCIe SSDs—to revolutionize the external data storage solutions, which allows us to transfer data at over 2000MB/s.

 

That's why TEKQ Rapide was born..

 

With Rapide, we at TEKQ are proud to announce that what we have created is going to be the fastest portable SSD available on the market. That’s fastest without any qualifiers – simply that, the fastest.

With Rapide, you can reach speeds as high as 40 GB/s, twice as fast as Thunderbolt 2 and eight times faster than USB 3.1 Gen1. Equipped with the Intel DSL6340 controller, the data transmission control center facilitating communication between the SSD and the computer, Rapide will set speed standards both for reading and writing, making it possible to transfer entire Blu-ray movies in under 30 seconds. Light and portable, this SSD requires no external power, and it is compatible with Mac and Windows devices with Thunderbolt 3.

 

Highlights

What is Thunderbolt 3?

Thunderbolt 3 is the latest version of the Thunderbolt interface. Thunderbolt 3 lets you transfer data at up to 40Gbps. 

That's 2x faster than the 20Gbps speed of Thunderbolt 2, and 4x faster than the 10Gbps speed of USB 3.1 Gen2 and the original Thunderbolt interface. 

Thunderbolt 3 also lets you connect speedy hard drives, various displays (including 4K and 5K resolutions), and other peripherals, like PCIe Gen 3 expansion cages, to your desktop or laptop.

With Thunderbolt 3 Transmitting interface, Rapide is able to free up the extremity of PCIe-based SSDs.

 

Thunderbolt 3 Connection + NVMe PCIe 3.0 x 4 Interface =Beast

The most common portable SSDs out there in the market adopt SATA III interface and USB 3.1 connection, e.g., Samsung T5, SanDisk Extreme, Glyph Atom. These SSDs delivers Read/Write Speeds of up to 540 MB/s, which is good for general use. But when it comes to professional use like transferring high volume media file, the speed rate is far from good. 

Rapide adopts NVMe PCIe 3.0 x 4 interface and Thunderbolt 3 connection. It is designed to transfer up to 5x faster than other regular SSDs and is able to transfer most blue-ray movies within 30 secs. Our new innovation is the much-awaited answer for professionals who have been looking for ultra fast data transfer and high volume storage for long.

These three photos are beautifully taken and authorized by thessdreview.com. They provides an excellent SSD spec summary here and let's just quote their words. "The large black module on the right side is the Intel Gen 3 JL6340 Thunderbolt 3 controller which provides up to 40Gbps bi-directional data transmission and reversible connectivity. "

"The TEKQ PSE7 is a 2280 form factor PCIe 3 NVMe SSD which contains the 8-channel Phison PS5007-11 E7 NVMe controller.  There are also four modules of Toshiba 15nm  128GB MLC NAND flash memory, numbered TH58TFT0DFLBA8H."

*Note: This one tested is Rapide 480G, so it contains four modules of 128GB MLC Flash, the number of module may vary with the capacity.

 

Third-Party Speed Test(by Prof. Dr. Gabriel of Universidad de Cordoba)

 

Special thanks to Prof. Dr. Gabriel. The tests Prof. Gabriel did are professional and comprehensive, including performance, thermal throttling and endurance. The advice he gave us on Thunderbolt 3 devices development is instructive and inspirational. He also introduced a few famous tech site editors and reviewers to us, which contributes much success to this campaign. We would say Prof. Gabriel is an academician outside and an entrepreneur inside.

__________________________________________________________________

Device Spec ：

iMac 27‑inch Retina 5K display 4.2 GHz (4.5 GHz Turbo Boost)

Intel Core i7 7th-generation (4 cores; 8 threads; model identifier iMac18,3 mid 2017)

40 GB RAM (2,400 MHz DDR4), Radeon Pro 580 with 2,304 cores & 8,192 MB VRAM.

Booting from internal internal Apple SSD SM2048L 2 TB (Samsung).

Operation System ：macOS Sierra 10.12.6 (16G1114)
Item Model： TEKQ Rapide Thunderbolt 3 SSD 480GB

__________________________________________________________________

Test on QuickBench

QuickBench separates out the speed of writing different sized files to the disk. It is used to measure the maximum speeds at which data can be transferred to and from a disk.

The avg. speed transferring data size from 20-100MB is able to reach Read 2.6GB/s and Read 1.9GB/s. Excelente!

Test on AJA (1GB File)

Both AJA and Blackmagic disk speed test are easy to use tools to quickly measure and certify your disk performance for working with high quality videos. Rapide delivers almost the same reading and writing speed on these two platforms at 2.0GB/s and 1.1GB/s.

Test on Disk Speed Test (5GB File)

Third-Party Speed Test#2(by Les Tokar of thessdreview.com)

 

Les Tokar, Chief Editor of thessdreview.com, hits 2.7G/s! He also shoots a lot of gorgeous photos for Rapide Thunderbolt 3. We appreciate his compliment and the Innovation Award he gave us. The performance benchmark we showcase here only features the speed. For info about how these disk benchmark software work and their differences, please visit to check out: Tekq Rapide TB3 Portable SSD Review (512GB) – Worlds Fastest Portable Storage

__________________________________________________________________

Device Spec ：

MOTHERBOARD: ASRock Z370 Taichi

CPU: Intel Coffee Lake Core i7-8770K 

CPU COOLER:   Corsair Hydro Series H110i GTX V.2

POWER SUPPLY: Corsair RM850x 80Plus

GRAPHICS: PNY GTX 1080 XLR8 Gaming OC

MEMORY: Corsair Dominator Pl 32GB 2800

STORAGE: Intel Optane 900P 480GB SSD

Operation System ：Microsoft Windows 10 Pro 64 Bit
Item Model： TEKQ Rapide Thunderbolt 3 SSD 480GB

__________________________________________________________________

 

Test on ATTO Disk Benchmark

The high read result: 2.8GB/s; The high write result: 2.3GB/s

 

Test on CrystalDiskMark Ver. 5.5.0 X64

Read: 2.7GB/s; Write: 1.5GB/s

 

Result on CrystalDiskInfo Ver. 7.5.0

As the report displays, TEKQ Rapide external SSD is operating on PCIe 3.0 x 4 (4 lanes), and also, it uses the NVM Express 1.2 protocol.

 

Excellent Heat-Dissipation without fan

We don't spend so much on the CNC machining just for a  thinner, stronger and more robust case. The aluminum case itself also act as a heat sink where this portable SSD uses passive heat dissipation by pushing heat to the external fins. With the fact that it has no fan, it is completely silent is a huge change from existing SSD storage devices.

As the Performance Consistency and Thermal Characteristics on Anandtech.com shows, the temperature of the internal SSD does not cross 60C at any point during the performance consistency testing. Throttling would not be an issue even if we take out the fan.

 

We are excited to bring Rapide to market with your help!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Right now, we have come to you, Indiegogo, for help raising $30,000. These funds will cover the costs of the production process, certification by both Intel and Apple and then launching and marketing our product to consumers worldwide.

Currently, there is a serious speed issue when it comes to the portable SSDs on the market. Most options use USB 3.0 or 3.1 ports, which is just unacceptable, and they required additional AC power, negating the convenience factor. Rapide is the way of the future, and by contributing to this campaign, you can own one before anyone else does!

The Impact

It’s time to set a new speed standard! Together, we can make Rapide the paragon of portable SSDs. Your contributions will make it possible for us to take the last few steps needed to make this happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

Outside of contributing monetarily, you can help us by sharing our campaign with all your friends and family. Go ahead and post the campaign link on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and any other social media platforms you use. We want people everywhere to know that they no longer need to put up with second-rate speed from their portable SSDs: Rapide is here to save the day.

We appreciate your support, and we thank you for your time.

 

About us

To the TEKQ team, a passion for Apple MFi accessories runs deep. Our commitment to producing great products is steadfast, and we have poured our hearts and souls into our latest offering, the Thunderbolt 3. We are looking to the future, our intention nothing short of revolutionary change. In the belief that technology can drive the possibility of a better world, we are doing all that we can at TEKQ to keep standards high.

Based out of Taiwan, we have produced two of the top-10 best-selling iPhone flash USB drives on Amazon, and our corporate clients have included the FBI and the United States Department of Defense.  We do business all around the world, and our partners and customers alike know they can expect innovation from us at all times.

 

FAQ

Here we collect most common questions about Rapide here. If you could not find what you're looking for here, don't hesitate to leave a message on our facebook or contact us through support@megagrand.com.tw.

 

Q: 240GB write speeds of KC1000 (900 MBps) is slower than what is claimed by TEKQ and shown in the benchmarks photo of the first mail. Can you clarify what exactly is the difference between the KC1000 and the internal SSD in the Rapide ?

(*NOTE: TEKQ claims Rapide adopts the same level NVMe PCIe SSD as Kingston KC1000, so this question is frequently asked)

A: Both of them are NVMe PCIe M.2. SSD. It is connection interface, IC controller, Firmware that makes the difference.


Q: Another question I had : the KC1000 claims to use MLC NAND - can you confirm what NAND (type, vendor) is being used in the Rapide ?

A: The SSD inside is Toshiba MLC Flash adopting PCIe Gen3x4. We've tried Samsung pm961/981 and Kingston KC1000. Result: Samsung pm961/981 has extreme reading speed up to  Read-3000MB/s but unstable write speed while KC1000 has compatibility issues with Macbook and we cannot solve that through IC controller and Firmware.

 

Q: No. of SSDs?  Which SSDs are in use?  Controller?

No. of SSD: TEKQ PSE7 2280 form factor PCIe 3 NVMe SSD

IC Controller: The 8-channel Phison PS5007-11 E7 NVMe controller. 

MLC adopted: Four modules of Toshiba 15nm  128GB MLC NAND flash memory, numbered TH58TFT0DFLBA8H.

 

Q: What capacities will this be available in?

A: Right now only 240GB/480GB/960GB available.

 

Q: North Amarican sales?

A: 2018 Q3


Q: Is this compatible with normal USB as it is not stated anywhere and I definitely cannot get it to work on my 2 PCs?  If it is, can you assist me getting it working? It seems to be be recognized in Device Manager as the Tekq but will not pop through as a recognized logical drive?  I also only get the limited thunderbolt 3 warning each time.

A:No, it can only work with devices with ACTUAL Thunderbolt 3 interface. It cannot work with USB, TB1, TB2. It cannot backward compatible even with an adapter, either.

This article may help: https://apple.stackexchange.com/questions/27807...

Here you can check devices with Thunderbolt 3: https://www.intel.com/buy/us/en/catalog/laptops...

 

Q: The option to buy empty shell and place for another drive to run it in raid?

A: Yes we'll provide empty shell solution in the future.

 

Q: Do you make this product for regular hard drive?
A: We've tested this with SATA III SSD but It has much lesser speed performance.
Only NVme PCIe Gen 3x4 SSD with Thnderbolt 3 interface could hit 2.5GB/s.
Also, your computer device must have ACTUAL Thunderbolt 3 port to work with Rapide.

 

Q: Dual thunderbolt ports since Thunderbolt is a daisy chain protocol
A: Yes we'll develop that model.
story_txt:
Boost productivity. Save TONS of time at your work.  If you have laptops or computers with Thunderbolt 3*(MacBook Pro 2016/2017, iMac 2017, Dell XPS, HP Elite Series/Spectre, etc.) and you need an external hard drive, what External Solid State Drive would you choose?What about Samsung T5, SanDisk Extreme, and Glyph Atom...?Nah..They just cannot free up the extremity of Thunderbolt 3 interface.What if you can transfer data 4x-5x FASTER than the mainstream portable SSDs out there in the market?If you can transfer data at Reading 2,300MB+/s and Writing 1,300MB+/s, why choose an inferior option?If you can transfer one blue-ray movie in under 30 secs, why bother whining about SSDs that just could not deliver the speed you want?*Note: TEKQ Rapide SSD only supports devices with Thunderbolt 3 and are not backward compatible with devices with Thunderbolt 1 and 2. Click here to check devices with Thunderbolt 3 built: https://www.tekq.com/Thunderbolt-3/Thunderbolt-...    
 
15GB Video files only takes Rapide 11 seconds to transfer!
This chart is Real World File Transfer Comparison by thessdreview.com. This is a comparison between Rapide and mainstream portable SSDs. As seen on the chart, each bar with different colors represents the seconds taken to transfer different media files at 15GB data size. 
15GB Video files only takes Rapide 11 seconds to transfer!
15GB Music files only takes Rapide 35 seconds to transfer!
15GB Photo files only takes Rapide 31 seconds to transfer!
How would that boost your productivity and save your time at work?
Considering Optane is not even a portable SSD and the mobility OWC RAID0 lacks, Rapide greatly outperforms its counterparts in terms of plug-and-play external data storage combining speed and mobility.
 



 
Rapide delivers 2x-3x much better result on transferring huge amount of media files.
The three charts above shows how the TEKQ Rapide behaves at real-world writing of different media file format(Higher is better).
For creative workers and business professionals, transferring of large amounts of photos and videos to and from the unit is the most common usage scenario, so Anandtech.com created three test folders with the following characteristics:

Photos: 15.6 GB collection of 4320 photos (RAW as well as JPEGs) in 61 sub-folders
Videos: 16.1 GB collection of 244 videos (MP4 as well as MOVs) in 6 sub-folders
BR: 10.7 GB Blu-ray folder structure of the IDT Benchmark Blu-ray

The tests were done on PCMark 8 Storage Bench, which recorded disk activity during real-world usage. As seen on the three charts, Rapide has beaten d2 Thunderbolt 2 SSD and Lacie Thunderbolt SSD with ease at 2x-3x faster speed rate.
Also, Rapide will save your time on importing files into or on exporting a multimedia out of editing program such as Adobe Photoshop, After Effect, and Illustrator. 



 
Light, Portable, Easy to CarrySince Rapide is Bus-Powered, you are able to plug in Rapide on your Thunderbolt 3 devices  without the need for a power adapter and backup your precious data with ease. Sized only slightly larger than a credit card(3.81in*2.16in/9.7cm*5.5cm) and weighs only 4.7oz(135g/0.29lb), Rapide is fairly pocket-friendly and won't occupy room whether it is used in an office or carried in a travel.When we decide to buy an external SSD, we want to boost our productivity - which means it should satisfy both the speed and mobility - Rapide is the answer.*Note: Photo with THESSDREVIEW Trademark are authorized by, and  its copyright belongs to thessdreview.com Elegant and sleek look. Match with your MacBook Pro.Last but not least, the lightweight sturdy metallic design not only matches your Mac with a sleek and elegant look, but also offers excellent heat dissipation with out fan. The extremely slim and lightweight design starts with an extruded block of aluminum that is carved out using CNC or "computer numerical control" machines.TEKQ Rapide Thunderbolt 3 SSD  ensures you won’t have to make any compromises when it comes to speed, mobility, and durability.*Note: Photo with TT Trademark are authorized by, and  its copyright belongs to TweakTown What techies say about Rapide Thunderbolt 3?"This is a beautiful beast with state-of-the-art guts inside. " Prof. Gabriel Dorado in Universidad de Cordoba"TEKQ took a giant leap with the Rapide, offering top tier performance for a single drive Thunderbolt 3 solution while staying competitive with its curent market pricing." TweakTown" It is drop dead gorgeous.  It’s storage speeds are not matched by anything worldwide." thessdreview.com"The performance of the TEKQ Rapide is top-notch and meets the claimed numbers." Anandtech.com"For a new product from a relatively no-name company, I am impressed with the design and performance of the TEKQ Rapide."pcper.com"The TEKQ Rapide is completely silent (and I can hear high frequencies so I say this with confidence)." macperformanceguide.com"The Sonnet Fusion Thunderbolt 3 PCIe Flash (Bus-Powered) Drive now has competition from the TEKQ TB3 Rapide in terms of speed, size, weight, and price." barefeats.com       Why we build the product?External data storage devices have evolved rapidly over the past few years. The evolution starts with the Hard Disk Drive (HDD) with USB 3.0 interface that's pricey and delivers only 150MB/s; then there comes high-performance external Solid-State Drives (SSD) that take advantage of the USB 3.0 and USB3.1 interface that allow us to transfer data at 500MB/s. The introduction of Peripheral Component Interconnect Express (PCIe) SSDs have enabled mass-market storage devices to break the SATA barrier. However, USB3.1 connection interface just could not free up the extremity of PCIe SSDs. Thunderbolt 3, the latest version of the Thunderbolt connection interface—is born to work with PCIe SSDs—to revolutionize the external data storage solutions, which allows us to transfer data at over 2000MB/s. That's why TEKQ Rapide was born.. With Rapide, we at TEKQ are proud to announce that what we have created is going to be the fastest portable SSD available on the market. That’s fastest without any qualifiers – simply that, the fastest.With Rapide, you can reach speeds as high as 40 GB/s, twice as fast as Thunderbolt 2 and eight times faster than USB 3.1 Gen1. Equipped with the Intel DSL6340 controller, the data transmission control center facilitating communication between the SSD and the computer, Rapide will set speed standards both for reading and writing, making it possible to transfer entire Blu-ray movies in under 30 seconds. Light and portable, this SSD requires no external power, and it is compatible with Mac and Windows devices with Thunderbolt 3. HighlightsWhat is Thunderbolt 3?Thunderbolt 3 is the latest version of the Thunderbolt interface. Thunderbolt 3 lets you transfer data at up to 40Gbps. That's 2x faster than the 20Gbps speed of Thunderbolt 2, and 4x faster than the 10Gbps speed of USB 3.1 Gen2 and the original Thunderbolt interface. Thunderbolt 3 also lets you connect speedy hard drives, various displays (including 4K and 5K resolutions), and other peripherals, like PCIe Gen 3 expansion cages, to your desktop or laptop.With Thunderbolt 3 Transmitting interface, Rapide is able to free up the extremity of PCIe-based SSDs. Thunderbolt 3 Connection + NVMe PCIe 3.0 x 4 Interface =BeastThe most common portable SSDs out there in the market adopt SATA III interface and USB 3.1 connection, e.g., Samsung T5, SanDisk Extreme, Glyph Atom. These SSDs delivers Read/Write Speeds of up to 540 MB/s, which is good for general use. But when it comes to professional use like transferring high volume media file, the speed rate is far from good. Rapide adopts NVMe PCIe 3.0 x 4 interface and Thunderbolt 3 connection. It is designed to transfer up to 5x faster than other regular SSDs and is able to transfer most blue-ray movies within 30 secs. Our new innovation is the much-awaited answer for professionals who have been looking for ultra fast data transfer and high volume storage for long.These three photos are beautifully taken and authorized by thessdreview.com. They provides an excellent SSD spec summary here and let's just quote their words. "The large black module on the right side is the Intel Gen 3 JL6340 Thunderbolt 3 controller which provides up to 40Gbps bi-directional data transmission and reversible connectivity. ""The TEKQ PSE7 is a 2280 form factor PCIe 3 NVMe SSD which contains the 8-channel Phison PS5007-11 E7 NVMe controller.  There are also four modules of Toshiba 15nm  128GB MLC NAND flash memory, numbered TH58TFT0DFLBA8H."*Note: This one tested is Rapide 480G, so it contains four modules of 128GB MLC Flash, the number of module may vary with the capacity. Third-Party Speed Test(by Prof. Dr. Gabriel of Universidad de Cordoba) Special thanks to Prof. Dr. Gabriel. The tests Prof. Gabriel did are professional and comprehensive, including performance, thermal throttling and endurance. The advice he gave us on Thunderbolt 3 devices development is instructive and inspirational. He also introduced a few famous tech site editors and reviewers to us, which contributes much success to this campaign. We would say Prof. Gabriel is an academician outside and an entrepreneur inside.__________________________________________________________________Device Spec ：iMac 27‑inch Retina 5K display 4.2 GHz (4.5 GHz Turbo Boost)Intel Core i7 7th-generation (4 cores; 8 threads; model identifier iMac18,3 mid 2017)40 GB RAM (2,400 MHz DDR4), Radeon Pro 580 with 2,304 cores & 8,192 MB VRAM.Booting from internal internal Apple SSD SM2048L 2 TB (Samsung).Operation System ：macOS Sierra 10.12.6 (16G1114)Item Model： TEKQ Rapide Thunderbolt 3 SSD 480GB__________________________________________________________________Test on QuickBenchQuickBench separates out the speed of writing different sized files to the disk. It is used to measure the maximum speeds at which data can be transferred to and from a disk.The avg. speed transferring data size from 20-100MB is able to reach Read 2.6GB/s and Read 1.9GB/s. Excelente!Test on AJA (1GB File) Both AJA and Blackmagic disk speed test are easy to use tools to quickly measure and certify your disk performance for working with high quality videos. Rapide delivers almost the same reading and writing speed on these two platforms at 2.0GB/s and 1.1GB/s.Test on Disk Speed Test (5GB File) Third-Party Speed Test#2(by Les Tokar of thessdreview.com) Les Tokar, Chief Editor of thessdreview.com, hits 2.7G/s! He also shoots a lot of gorgeous photos for Rapide Thunderbolt 3. We appreciate his compliment and the Innovation Award he gave us. The performance benchmark we showcase here only features the speed. For info about how these disk benchmark software work and their differences, please visit to check out: Tekq Rapide TB3 Portable SSD Review (512GB) – Worlds Fastest Portable Storage__________________________________________________________________Device Spec ：MOTHERBOARD: ASRock Z370 TaichiCPU: Intel Coffee Lake Core i7-8770K CPU COOLER:   Corsair Hydro Series H110i GTX V.2POWER SUPPLY: Corsair RM850x 80PlusGRAPHICS: PNY GTX 1080 XLR8 Gaming OCMEMORY: Corsair Dominator Pl 32GB 2800STORAGE: Intel Optane 900P 480GB SSDOperation System ：Microsoft Windows 10 Pro 64 BitItem Model： TEKQ Rapide Thunderbolt 3 SSD 480GB__________________________________________________________________ Test on ATTO Disk BenchmarkThe high read result: 2.8GB/s; The high write result: 2.3GB/s Test on CrystalDiskMark Ver. 5.5.0 X64Read: 2.7GB/s; Write: 1.5GB/s Result on CrystalDiskInfo Ver. 7.5.0As the report displays, TEKQ Rapide external SSD is operating on PCIe 3.0 x 4 (4 lanes), and also, it uses the NVM Express 1.2 protocol. Excellent Heat-Dissipation without fanWe don't spend so much on the CNC machining just for a  thinner, stronger and more robust case. The aluminum case itself also act as a heat sink where this portable SSD uses passive heat dissipation by pushing heat to the external fins. With the fact that it has no fan, it is completely silent is a huge change from existing SSD storage devices.As the Performance Consistency and Thermal Characteristics on Anandtech.com shows, the temperature of the internal SSD does not cross 60C at any point during the performance consistency testing. Throttling would not be an issue even if we take out the fan. We are excited to bring Rapide to market with your help! What We Need & What You GetRight now, we have come to you, Indiegogo, for help raising $30,000. These funds will cover the costs of the production process, certification by both Intel and Apple and then launching and marketing our product to consumers worldwide.Currently, there is a serious speed issue when it comes to the portable SSDs on the market. story:
F.A.Q.s are at the bottom of the page..

Short Summary

Hi. We're Smart Equine Media. We are Cheryl Harless and Patricia Reszetylo.

 

Cheryl… 

I'm a country gal at heart, raised in the big city of San Diego, CA. I fell in love with horses at the age of 3 and haven't looked back. After begging for a horse of my own for years, I finally got my first horse when I was 11.

By the time I was 13, I was riding in local shows and breaking and training young horses to ride. I rode Western Pleasure, Equitation and Trail classes. I also participated in Gymkhanas, excelling at barrel racing. I went on multiple trail rides each week and those were the happiest times of my life.

Sadly, by the age of 17 I had to give up my horses but I'm determined to have a house of my own where I can have them, and a few other barnyard critters, again.

I have been the owner of CH Enterprises (Administrative Consultant Services) since 2007 and The Equine Admin since 2011 where I provide ongoing, collaborative, administrative support for Equine Professionals.

Patricia… I’m a horse lover, owner, student and competitor from Northern Minnesota.  I’ve brought leading-edge information to equestrians world-wide since 2005, starting with free teleseminars at EquineTeleseminar.net, and free equestrian gifts at FreeHorseGifts.com. 

We teamed up in 2011 to create the first-ever Equine Business Success Telesummit, bringing some of the top marketing and sales strategies to small horse businesses around the world.

The PROJECT - Our Mission

As equestrians ourselves, we have a mission to bring our fellow equine business owners, competitors and students tools and information that allow you to do these 3 things – SPECIFICALLY for your event:

  1. Properly pack your trailer for that show, lesson or clinic, so that you have the peace of mind that comes with knowing you have EVERYTHING you need.  No more forgotten saddles, boots or breeches…
  2. Learn how to get funding via sponsorships or other means for your riding career, so that you can finally become the rider you KNOW you’re destined to be;
  3. Know/remember your between-lesson homework – especially if you only get to lessons or clinics occasionally.  No more wasted sessions wondering what you were supposed to do, wandering around the ring hoping you’re doing your homework, or listening to your instructor tell you the same old things over and over, session after session, with little appreciable progress. Now you’ll actually progress up the levels at a decent rate.

Sound interesting yet?  Do YOU have any of those issues?  Would solving ANY of them make training or competing more rewarding?

Our project is a smart phone app and website, for both iPhone and Android phones that brings you those tools and info.   It’s all right on your smartphone, right at your finger tips. 

What We Need & What You Get

Everyone that we have shared the ideas with loves it - but we need your help.

We need to raise $50,000 to cover the cost of this start-up which includes the programming, initial marketing and artwork or this project will die, leaving millions of equestrians who need it out in the cold.  We don’t personally have the financial resources to do this on our own, so we're turning to you, our strongest supporters, to ask for contributions. In exchange, we're offering:

  1. The opportunity to get the app before anybody else while it is still free (be the first to get your hands on the app – YOU get to be the trendsetter!);
  2. Deep, deep discounts on future products/services offered though the app;
  3. Some really cool gifts that we’ll ship out at the end of the promo!

We're setting up the promo so that we get all the funds contributed, even if we don't reach our goal of $50,000.  In that case, we'll put a down payment on programming, getting work started on it, and then resume our drive to raise the balance of funds.  We'll keep you updated on exactly where we are in the process as we go along.

Your contribution helps us build this one-of-a-kind, leading-edge Dressage app; helps us reach and assist millions of equestrians worldwide JUST LIKE YOU in a number of specific disciplines and breeds, giving them tools to expand both their businesses and riding careers – AND gets you on the top of the “Early Bird” list.  You’ll be the first to get the app, you’ll get to help shape it, and you’ll get the pride of knowing you helped build the premier tool for equestrians!

We thank you – and the equestrian world at large thanks you for helping us bring this app to life!

The Impact

While this project is personally valuable to both Cheryl and Patricia, bringing them financial independence, it's also very valuable to equestrians worldwide. 

  • Properly pack a trailer for that show, lesson or clinic, for that peace of mind that comes with knowing you have EVERYTHING you need.  No more forgotten saddles, boots or breeches…
  • Learn how to get funding via sponsorships or other means for your riding career, so that you can finally become the rider you KNOW you’re destined to be;
  • Know/remember your between-lesson homework – especially if you only get to lessons or clinics occasionally.  No more wasted sessions wondering what you were supposed to do, wandering around the ring hoping you’re doing your homework, or listening to your instructor tell you the same old things over and over, session after session, with little appreciable progress. Now you’ll actually progress up the levels at a decent rate.
We anticipate the app will be used by millions of equestrians world-wide - when the dressage app is proven, we'll release versions for other equine sports/disciplines, - and possibly breeds, too - each catering to the unique needs of those equestrians.  We may also release them in different languages - all depending on what the users tell us they need.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can contribute, that is just wonderful!!  If you can't contribute, there are other ways you can help:

  • Help us to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign to your friends on Facebook, Twitter, Google+ and other social media.
  • Please use use the Indiegogo share tools!

Again, your contribution helps us build this one-of-a-kind, leading-edge Dressage app; helps us reach and assist millions of equestrians worldwide JUST LIKE YOU in a number of specific disciplines and breeds, giving them tools to expand both their businesses and riding careers – AND gets you on the top of the “Early Bird” list.  You’ll be the first to get the app, you’ll get to help shape it, and you’ll get the pride of knowing you helped build the premier tool for equestrians!

We thank you – and the equestrian world at large thanks you for helping us bring this app to life!

 

F.A.Q.s will be added here...

Q: What future enhancements/plans do you have for this app?

A: We have a number of ideas - Horse Show functions, so you'll search, register, check-in and look up results via the app; a goal tracking module and a "courses" or "patterns" module, along with others.  Of course we want to know what you want/need/will use!

Q: Where do I find the trial version of the app, so that I can leave feedback for you?

A: Right now, there is no trial version.  This fundraiser is for the initial programming.  We'd greatly appreciate feedback on the ideas we share with the video and text above.

Properly pack your trailer for that show, lesson or clinic, so that you have the peace of mind that comes with knowing you have EVERYTHING you need.  No more forgotten saddles, boots or breeches…

Learn how to get funding via sponsorships or other means for your riding career, so that you can finally become the rider you KNOW you’re destined to be;

Know/remember your between-lesson homework – especially if you only get to lessons or clinics occasionally.  No more wasted sessions wondering what you were supposed to do, wandering around the ring hoping you’re doing your homework, or listening to your instructor tell you the same old things over and over, session after session, with little appreciable progress. Now you’ll actually progress up the levels at a decent rate.

Sound interesting yet?  Do YOU have any of those issues?  Would solving ANY of them make training or competing more rewarding?
Our project is a smart phone app and website, for both iPhone and Android phones that brings you those tools and info.   It’s all right on your smartphone, right at your finger tips. 


What We Need & What You Get
Everyone that we have shared the ideas with loves it - but we need your help.
We need to raise $50,000 to cover the cost of this start-up which includes the programming, initial marketing and artwork or this project will die, leaving millions of equestrians who need it out in the cold.  We don’t personally have the financial resources to do this on our own, so we're turning to you, our strongest supporters, to ask for contributions. In exchange, we're offering:

The opportunity to get the app before anybody else while it is still free (be the first to get your hands on the app – YOU get to be the trendsetter!);
Deep, deep discounts on future products/services offered though the app;
Some really cool gifts that we’ll ship out at the end of the promo!

We're setting up the promo so that we get all the funds contributed, even if we don't reach our goal of $50,000.  In that case, we'll put a down payment on programming, getting work started on it, and then resume our drive to raise the balance of funds.  We'll keep you updated on exactly where we are in the process as we go along.
Your contribution helps us build this one-of-a-kind, leading-edge Dressage app; helps us reach and assist millions of equestrians worldwide JUST LIKE YOU in a number of specific disciplines and breeds, giving them tools to expand both their businesses and riding careers – AND gets you on the top of the “Early Bird” list.  You’ll be the first to get the app, you’ll get to help shape it, and you’ll get the pride of knowing you helped build the premier tool for equestrians!
We thank you – and the equestrian world at large thanks you for helping us bring this app to life!


The Impact
While this project is personally valuable to both Cheryl and Patricia, bringing them financial independence, it's also very valuable to equestrians worldwide. 


Properly pack a trailer for that show, lesson or clinic, for that peace of mind that comes with knowing you have EVERYTHING you need.  No more forgotten saddles, boots or breeches…

Learn how to get funding via sponsorships or other means for your riding career, so that you can finally become the rider you KNOW you’re destined to be;

Know/remember your between-lesson homework – especially if you only get to lessons or clinics occasionally.  No more wasted sessions wondering what you were supposed to do, wandering around the ring hoping you’re doing your homework, or listening to your instructor tell you the same old things over and over, session after session, with little appreciable progress. Now you’ll actually progress up the levels at a decent rate.

We anticipate the app will be used by millions of equestrians world-wide - when the dressage app is proven, we'll release versions for other equine sports/disciplines, - and possibly breeds, too - each catering to the unique needs of those equestrians.  We may also release them in different languages - all depending on what the users tell us they need.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can contribute, that is just wonderful!!  If you can't contribute, there are other ways you can help:

Help us to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign to your friends on Facebook, Twitter, Google+ and other social media.
Please use use the Indiegogo share tools!


Again, your contribution helps us build this one-of-a-kind, leading-edge Dressage app; helps us reach and assist millions of equestrians worldwide JUST LIKE YOU in a number of specific disciplines and breeds, giving them tools to expand both their businesses and riding careers – AND gets you on the top of the “Early Bird” list.  You’ll be the first to get the app, you’ll get to help shape it, and you’ll get the pride of knowing you helped build the premier tool for equestrians!
We thank you – and the equestrian world at large thanks you for helping us bring this app to life!
 

F.A.Q.s will be added here...
Q: What future enhancements/plans do you have for this app?
A: We have a number of ideas - Horse Show functions, so you'll search, register, check-in and look up results via the app; a goal tracking module and a "courses" or "patterns" module, along with others.  Of course we want to know what you want/need/will use!
Q: Where do I find the trial version of the app, so that I can leave feedback for you?
A: Right now, there is no trial version.  This fundraiser is for the initial programming.  We'd greatly appreciate feedback on the ideas we share with the video and text above.

story:
REENBERGS is a family-owned Danish company specializing in designing and manufacturing products for the home. It was established by Grethe Reenberg and her daughter Line Reenberg Vilstrup in 2006. Since then we have been developing innovative products in Denmark, with a view to to exporting to different markets around the world.

REENBERGS believe in well designed and quality made products that make our lives just a little bit easier. 

- The two founders Line Reenberg Vilstrup (Left) and Grethe Reenberg (Right)

Q: I'm pretty sure I have seen one of these products before?

A: You might have! We have been selling them in Scandinavia and few other regions for a couple of years now. We also have a few partners who sell our products under their own branding, but we're the original designer and manufacturer of these great products!

Q: How do I remove the glued magnet from a surface?

A: Just use a thin and strong cord, like a dental floss, to 'cut' the magnet off the surface. It leaves no marks or spots. It is as simple and easy as that.


If you have any questions or feedback, please don't hesitate to contact our designated Campaign Manager Jonas at jonas@reenbergs.dk and he will help you with your inquiries.

story:
The world's most intelligent car battery

Ohm is a new kind of car battery that never needs to be jump started, works reliably on the coldest winter days, lasts twice as long as the average lead-acid battery, and weighs just 6 pounds.

 

 

 

    

 

 

Ohm is smart enough to keep you from accidentally draining your battery if you forget to turn your lights off. It will automatically turn itself off when it gets critically low, and then switch itself back on when you go to start your car. No more getting stranded with a dead battery. Ohm also monitors and regulates itself to prolong its lifetime and accurately predict when it will need to be replaced.  

Ohm's supercapacitors deliver a powerful burst of energy directly to your starter. They work well in low temperatures because they don't rely on a chemical reaction, and they can be cycled hundreds of thousands of times. They're what ensures that your car will start every time you turn the key.

 

 We all know the pain of leaving your lights on and waking up to a dead battery. Ohm’s built-in circuitry monitors the supercapacitor’s potential output; if it’s ever about to reach the point that it’ll no longer be able to start your car, it’ll just turn itself off. Once you turn the key, everything will spring right back to life, no jump start required.

 

 

Installing Ohm is easy. It goes in just like your old battery. Simply disconnect the terminals, drop in Ohm, and reconnect. Remember to connect the positive/red lead first to reduce the risk of sparking.

For our first production run, Ohm will be available in two sizes. The primary size will fit in vehicles capable of accepting group 35 batteries. This size will fit in most cars, including those that use a size other than group 35, but may require some extra fixturing in that case. The secondary size does not conform to a typical group size and can be used to fit in smaller battery wells, but also may need fixturing. You can use this tool to find out if Ohm will work with your car:

Once you become a backer, we will send you an email to get more information about your car, including if you need the larger or smaller size and if you need the polarity on the terminals reversed. If your vehicle requires side terminals, select the side terminal perk and we'll include adapters to use Ohm in a side terminal configuration.

Like all batteries, eventually Ohm will need to be replaced. Once it predicts the need for replacement, Ohm will give you notice a couple of days in advance by periodically beeping. This will give you an earlier and more accurate warning about Ohm's remaining lifetime than the dashboard battery light.

 

Traditional car batteries rely on a chemical reaction. When they're discharged, the reaction turns chemical energy into electricity. When they're charged, the reaction is reversed. In lead-acid batteries, this process eventually results in a buildup of gunk called sulfation which reduces the lifetime of the battery. Chemical reactions also depend on temperature, since a lower temperature means the reaction happens at a slower rate. Ohm uses supercapacitors rather than batteries to provide most of the starting current. Supercapacitors don't use a chemical reaction, but instead store energy in an electrostatic field. This allows supercapacitors to have a longer lifetime, lower weight, and better performance over temperature. Ohm also has a lithium iron phosphate battery (LiFePO4) that it uses to keep the supercapacitors charged. This battery does rely on a chemical reaction, but still has over twice the lifetime of lead-acid batteries.

[1] Lithium Ferro Phosphate Batteries
[2] Product Guide: Maxwell Technologies® BOOSTCAP® Ultracapacitors

 

Important Note: The specifications listed here are preliminary. We arrived at them through a combination of testing and calculating based on manufacturer specifications. As we continue to develop and test Ohm, some of these specifications may change. 

 

When we designed Ohm, we set out to not just rethink the functionality of car batteries, but also the design. Our goal was to create an elegant and distinct product that was also manufacturable and easy to scale to different battery sizes for manufacturing.


Current Status

Currently, we have tested Ohm in a variety of vehicles and Ohm has been driven on for thousands of miles. However, there is still a lot to do. Battery management  and safety circuitry has been designed, fabricated, and is in the early stages of testing. Early temperature and lifecycle testing has begun, but is not finished yet. Sensing and control for the auto shutdown and wake up process (eg preventing a dead battery)  is working on the bench for our primary test car, but still needs to be integrated to the rest of the design and tested on more cars. 


Early Prototypes



 

Alex and Hunter are both engineers from Georgia Tech. They have worked together on a variety of robotics and electronics projects. Alex was most recently designing algorithms for high frequency trading and Hunter was leading the electrical engineering on several products at Motorola Solutions.


What are Ohms core features?

Ohm's core features are its low weight, long lifetime, superior cold weather performance, and its environmentally friendly design. It weighs six pounds, lasts about twice as long as the average lead-acid car battery, works in temperatures as low as -30C, and contains no lead or acid.

How does Ohm work?

Ohm uses EDLC supercapacitors to supply a high burst of energy to the car's starter. It also uses a  small array of Lithium Iron Phosphate batteries to keep the supercapacitors charged when the car engine isn't running. These two systems are monitored and controlled by intelligent electronics  that ensure optimal performance over the lifetime of the device.

Will Ohm work with my car?

Ohm is available in two sizes. The larger size has dimensions of 9.0"x6.8"x7.5", and will fit Group 35 batteries. It will also fit some additional group sizes, but may require some extra fixturing. The smaller size has dimensions of 9.0"x4.0"x7.5" and does not correspond to a particular battery group size, but may instead be used for smaller battery wells and will also likely require fixturing. To determine if your car will work with Ohm, use this tool.

How do I install Ohm?

Ohm is a drop in replacement for your existing car battery, and it's installed in the same way. Simply remove the positive and negative leads from your old battery, drop in Ohm, and reattach the lead to Ohm (red/positive lead first to prevent sparking). Make sure to tighten the mounting harness to prevent Ohm from moving during normal use. 

Can I buy Ohm if I live outside the United States?

We ship to most countries for an additional shipping fee. There may be a delay for Ohm to ship to certain countries. Please consult your national customs office for specific duties and tax rates. Ohm is not responsible for any import taxes, duties, or brokerages fees which may be incurred on your international order shipment 

Isn't the 10 amp hours capacity of Ohm really small? Is that enough? 

Based on our experience and talking to people, we found that most people don't ever use the reserve capacity of their battery for more than a few minutes. So one of the trade offs of Ohm is that the reserve capacity is reduced from a normal battery. Since Ohm automatically saves a reserve amount of energy, you don't need to worry about accidentally draining it when using the reserve capacity like you would with your old battery. If you need to run electronics with your engine off for long periods of time, you're probably better off with a deep cycle lead acid battery.

How long can I run my stereo or lights on Ohm without running my engine?

Ohm's reserve capacity is 10 Amp hours. The amount of time Ohm can run your auxiliary electronics without running the engine depends on the amount of current your devices consume. The typical car stereo consumes about 2 amps of current at medium volume, which means that you could run it on Ohm with the engine off for hours without worry. Headlights draw about 15A and the battery will allow these to run for about 30 minutes before Ohm disconnects the battery to retain energy for cranking.

What if I my car needs a battery with the terminals reversed?

We'll send you an email after you become a backer and get some more information, including whether or not you need reversed terminals and ship you a version that will work for you.

What are the advantages of supercapacitors?

Supercapacitors are excellent at delivering energy very quickly. This is because, unlike batteries, they do not rely on a chemical reaction but instead store energy in an electrostatic field. This lets supercapacitors weigh less and perform better in colder temperatures than most batteries.

Can Ohm be jumped started if it needs to be?

Yes, you can jump start Ohm like you would a normal battery.

Can Ohm jump start other cars?

Yes. When you re jumping another car from yours, you should always have your engine running so that the alternator can assist in providing current, but in a pinch, Ohm should be able to jump a car by itself.

Can I use Ohm in my boat?

We aren't planning to rigorously test or certify Ohm for marine environments yet, so if you try it, it's at your own risk. However, there's no reason why it wouldn't work in principal assuming your engine has an alternator to recharge the battery. Note that Ohm has a 10 amp hour capacity, so if your boat requires a lot of reserve capacity (for running sonar or lights or a sound system all day on the water), you may be better off with a deep cycle marine battery, or perhaps an Ohm in parallel with a deep cycle battery, to prevent the need for jump starting on the water. 

Can I use Ohm with my trolling motor?

Ohm has a reserve capacity of 10 amp hours, which means it would probably not work well with a trolling motor. Trolling motors don't have an alternator, and would quickly deplete the energy within Ohm.  

Can I use Ohm in my airplane?

We aren't planning to rigorously test or certify Ohm for use in any aircraft, so we do not recommend it. If you do try it, it's at your own risk. 

I have a large audio system, will Ohm work with it?

We haven't tested Ohm with every possible combination of amplifier and speaker, but we believe Ohm should work well with aftermarket audio systems. The supercapacitors within Ohm can provide large current spikes needed to drive large amplifier and speaker loads. The reserve capacity is 10 amp hours, so we recommend running your engine while using your sound system.

Will you offer a smaller version of Ohm?

Ohm is available in two sizes, a larger group 35 compatible version and a smaller custom version. The guts of Ohm don't take up much space, so shifting to a smaller size shouldn't be too difficult, but right now we're focusing on getting the larger version for cars right before offering more sizes.

Will you offer a version of Ohm for motorcycles?

Right now, we do not offer a version for motorcycles. See the previous question for details.

Who is Ohm for?

Ohm is well suited for performance driving enthusiasts (autocross, track days, wheel to wheel, etc), people who live in cold climates, as well as people who are simply tired of getting stuck with a run down battery. 

How long can Ohm sit on a shelf?

Ohm has a shelf life of approximately 12 months.

How long can Ohm sit in my car without use?

Ohm can sit in most cars for about 3 months before needing to be recharged. It will remain in its normal state for approximately one month (depending on the idle current drawn by your particular car). At that point, it will go into hibernation to save enough reserve energy to still be able to crank the engine, reducing current draw to be only the battery's self discharge. It will remain in this state until you turn the key to wake Ohm up. After waiting about 30 seconds for the supercapacitors to recharge, you'll be able to turn the key and start your car.

What's the deal with the CCA rating?

It turns out that Cold Cranking Amps (CCA) aren't a very good measure of whether or not a battery will start a car. It's an old metric left over from when cars first started using lead acid batteries. Instead we use peak cold cranking amps, which is the amount of current that can be delivered by the both the supercapacitors and batteries over a period of a few seconds. 

Does Ohm work with diesel cars?

We're still testing Ohm with diesel cars, so we don't feel comfortable definitively saying it will work with them yet. Once we finish testing, we'll be able to say for sure.

Is Ohm safe?

Yes. The supercapacitors used in Ohm are mostly carbon and a few milliliters of electrolyte. The batteries are LiFePO4, which are  very stable and are used in some electric vehicles. We wouldn't ship anything we're not comfortable with our parents,  brothers, and sisters driving with.

What is your refund and cancellation policy?

You can cancel your order and get a full refund anytime before shipping. Ohm will likely change before its release as we improve performance and consider input from our first users. If Ohm isn't all you thought it would be when you get it, you have 30 days to return it. If you choose to do so, you'll be responsible for shipping fees.

What is your warranty policy?

Ohm's warranty will change as more testing is completed to determine the average lifetime. All customers will be automatically grandfathered in to any longer warranties issued after testing is complete. Initially, Ohm is warranted to be free from defects in materials or workmanship for one year from the date it is shipped. Within this period, Ohm will, at its sole option, repair or replace any components that fail in normal use. Such repairs or replacement will be made at no charge to the customer for parts or labor, provided that the customer shall be responsible for any transportation cost. This warranty does not apply to: (i) cosmetic damage, such as scratches, nicks and dents; (ii) damage caused by accident, abuse, misuse, water, flood, fire, or other acts of nature or external causes; (iii) damage caused by service performed by anyone who is not an authorized service provider of Ohm; (iv) damage to a product that has been modified or altered without the written permission of Ohm; or (vi) damage to a product that has been connected to vehicles or devices not supported by Ohm. In addition, Ohm reserves the right to refuse warranty claims against products or services that are obtained and/or used in contravention of the laws of any country.

When will I get my Ohm?

Ohm is currently planned to ship in early to mid 2016.

I don't see my question!

We'd be happy to answer it! Just shoot an email to hello@getohm.com.

It will remain in its normal state for approximately one month (depending on the idle current drawn by your particular car). At that point, it will go into hibernation to save enough reserve energy to still be able to crank the engine, reducing current draw to be only the battery's self discharge. It will remain in this state until you turn the key to wake Ohm up. After waiting about 30 seconds for the supercapacitors to recharge, you'll be able to turn the key and start your car.
What's the deal with the CCA rating?
It turns out that Cold Cranking Amps (CCA) aren't a very good measure of whether or not a battery will start a car. It's an old metric left over from when cars first started using lead acid batteries. Instead we use peak cold cranking amps, which is the amount of current that can be delivered by the both the supercapacitors and batteries over a period of a few seconds. 
Does Ohm work with diesel cars?
We're still testing Ohm with diesel cars, so we don't feel comfortable definitively saying it will work with them yet. Once we finish testing, we'll be able to say for sure.
Is Ohm safe?
Yes. The supercapacitors used in Ohm are mostly carbon and a few milliliters of electrolyte. The batteries are LiFePO4, which are  very stable and are used in some electric vehicles. We wouldn't ship anything we're not comfortable with our parents,  brothers, and sisters driving with.
What is your refund and cancellation policy?
You can cancel your order and get a full refund anytime before shipping. Ohm will likely change before its release as we improve performance and consider input from our first users. If Ohm isn't all you thought it would be when you get it, you have 30 days to return it. If you choose to do so, you'll be responsible for shipping fees.
What is your warranty policy?
Ohm's warranty will change as more testing is completed to determine the average lifetime. All customers will be automatically grandfathered in to any longer warranties issued after testing is complete. Initially, Ohm is warranted to be free from defects in materials or workmanship for one year from the date it is shipped. Within this period, Ohm will, at its sole option, repair or replace any components that fail in normal use. Such repairs or replacement will be made at no charge to the customer for parts or labor, provided that the customer shall be responsible for any transportation cost. This warranty does not apply to: (i) cosmetic damage, such as scratches, nicks and dents; (ii) damage caused by accident, abuse, misuse, water, flood, fire, or other acts of nature or external causes; (iii) damage caused by service performed by anyone who is not an authorized service provider of Ohm; (iv) damage to a product that has been modified or altered without the written permission of Ohm; or (vi) damage to a product that has been connected to vehicles or devices not supported by Ohm. In addition, Ohm reserves the right to refuse warranty claims against products or services that are obtained and/or used in contravention of the laws of any country.
When will I get my Ohm?
Ohm is currently planned to ship in early to mid 2016.
I don't see my question!
We'd be happy to answer it! Just shoot an email to hello@getohm.com.

story:
So, some of you may know me, some may not.

My online name is Panjno! - I make almost daily content featuring PC Games, tutorials and help and entertain others. I strive to provide the highest quality content in every aspect. This is why i have started to upgrade my PC. I've purchased the new CPU (i7 5820k) & the new power supply, but I've ran out of money.. :( THIS MAKES ME VERY SAD.

So, the reason for this campaign? - You always here how people get hundreds of thousands of $ for making salads.. Every penny or cent donated will go towards the Motherboard and RAM Only. Nothing else, i just look to my left and see the $400 CPU sat there in its box :( 

The Upgrade will help me produce more frequent 4K Video content, videos at the moment take me anywhere from 2-9 hours to render! let alone the hours of recording and editing.. Its all worth it in the end and dont get me wrong, i love doing it.. But my machine just cant handle it. He's a old fella and he needs a rest.. plz help me save him and put him to rest.


So please, if you have anything spare and want to help, please do. If you dont have a spare few dollars please dont. But those who can, please do.


You will receive:

My love and attention, a shout out in my thank you video.. with social media links..

A spot on my Steam friends list for life.

And a little thank you note :)


Thanks a ton for even taking the time to read through this, it means alot. I didn't want to ask for too much, just what i need to buy it. I wouldn't be asking for it if i didnt need it.. :)

Thanks a ton guys & gals!

https://www.youtube.com/user/PanjnoTutorials

Love,

Panjno!
